div.pre: 1891 Calabria (anc. Bruttium), 1833 (180) Burial: c. 460 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 381 AR Taras: 1 incuse st. 39 double-relief st. (rev. hippocamp 13; wheel 19; female hd. 7 fdc) Laus: 5 st. (1 incuse; 4 double-relief) Metapontum: 86 st. (incl. dumpy incuse) Poseidonia: 24 double-relief st. Sirinus-Pyxus: 1 st. Sybaris: 13 st. Caulonia: 49 st. (13 incuse; 36 double- relief) Croton: 99 incuse st. (94 rev. tripod incl. 5 QΡΟ/ΤΕ; 2 rev. Cor. helmet; 3 rev, eagle) Rhegium: 3 tetradr. (mule-car/hare) Acragas: 1 didr. Gela: 1 tetradr. Messana: 23 tetradr. (mule-car/hare) Syracuse: 36 tetradr. Disposition: dispersed Avellino, Opuscoli diversi 2 (Naples, 1833), pp. 85, 167 Sambon, Recherches, p. 28 Mommsen, Hist. de la monn. rom. 1 (Paris, 1865), p. 151 Jenkins, Gela, p. 148 The presence of a substantial number of Sicilian issues suggests burial in the neighborhood of Rhegium
